718198f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Bridal path.
718198f-a.text:
Central Park, Bridle Paths: A view in the southwestern corner in a westerly direction to show several riders availing themselves of these park facilities. The apartment building shown is at the S.W. corner of Central Park West and West 69th Street; being Viewed across an excavation
at the N.W. corner of same.
October 10, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718198f-a.folder: Central Park & Bridal path., Manhattan, NY

718196f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Bridal path.
718196f-a.text:
Central Park: Four mounted policemen on a bridle path in the southwestern part of the Park; the view is northwest towards Central Park West and 71st Street.
May 15, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
718196f-a.folder: Central Park & Bridal path., Manhattan, NY

718193f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Bridal path.
718193f-a.text:
"Bridle path in Central Park"
El Dorado Towers bet. 90th and 91st Streets CPW
Hans WW. Hannau, photographer
6338

Neg. 3 1774
718193f-a.folder: Central Park & Bridal path., Manhattan, NY

718195f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Bridal path.
718195f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park: Bridle Path near the southeastern corner of the park,
with the hotels at the Plaza in the background.
May 25, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A similar view and showing only the Plaza Hotel across the trees.
May 10, 1910.
Walter L. Bogert.
718195f-a.folder: Central Park & Bridal path., Manhattan, NY

718197f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Bridal path.
718197f-b.text:
Central Park: A pedestrian bridge over the bridle path. This structure is near the tennis courts in the North Meadow. The photographer is viewing northward in No. 1 and westward in No. 2.
May 18, 1933.
View 2:-May 31, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
718197f-b.folder: Central Park & Bridal path., Manhattan, NY
